column1: 2 ^ Dòmine in virtúte tua laĕtábitur rex, et super salutáre tuum exsultábit vehemènter. ^ In thy strength, O Lord, the king shall joy~
column2: and in thy salvation he shall rejoice exceedingly.

column1: 3 ^ Desidèrium cordis ejus tribuvìsti ei, et voluntáte labiórum ejus non fraŭdavìsti eum. ^ Thou hast given him his heart's desire, and hast not withholden from him the will of his lips.
4 ^ Qŭóniam praĕvenìsti eum in benedictiónibus dulcédinis~
column2: posuìsti in cápite ejus corónam de lápide pretióso. ^ For thou hast prevented him with blessings of sweetness~
column3: thou hast set on his head a crown of precious stones.

column1: 5 ^ Vitam petívit a te, et tribuvìsti ei longitúdinem diérum in sáĕculum et in sáĕculum sáĕculi. ^ He asked life of thee, and thou hast given him length of days for ever and ever.
6 ^ Magna est glória ejus in salutári tuo~
column2: glóriam et magnum decórem impónes super eum. ^ His glory is great in thy salvation~
column3: glory and great beauty shalt thou lay upon him.

column1: 7 ^ Qŭóniam dabis eum in benedictiónem in sáĕculum sáĕculi~
column2: laĕtificábis eum in gáŭdio cum vùltu tuo. ^ For thou shalt give him to be a blessing for ever and ever~
column3: thou shalt make him joyful in gladness with thy countenance.

column1: 8 ^ Qŭóniam rex sperat in Dòmino, et in misericórdia Altìssimi non commovébitur. ^ For the king hopeth in the Lord, and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.
9 ^ Inveniátur manus tua òmnibus inimícîs tuîs~
column2: dèxtera tua invèniat òmnes qŭi te odérunt. ^ Let thy hand be found by all thy enemies~
column3: let thy right hand find out all them that hate thee.

column1: 10 ^ Pones eos ut clíbanum ìgnis in tèmpore vùltûs tui~
column2: Dòminus in ira sua conturbábit eos, et devorábit eos ìgnis. ^ Thou shalt make them as an oven of fire in the time of thy presence~
column3: the Lord shall trouble them in his wrath, and fire shall devour them.

column1: 11 ^ Fructum eórum de terra pèrdes, et semen eórum a fíliîs hòminum. ^ Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from among the children of men.

column2: cogitavérunt consìlia qŭaĕ non potuérunt stabilíre. ^ For they have intended evils against thee~
column3: they have devised counsels which they have not been able to establish.

column2: in relíquiîs tuîs praĕparábis vùltum eórum. ^ For thou shalt make them turn their back~
column3: in thy remnants thou shalt prepare their face.

column2: cantábimus et psallémus virtútes tuas. ^ Be thou exalted, O Lord, in thy own strength~
column3: we will sing and praise thy power.
